stk.molecular.topologies.polymer module¶

class stk.molecular.topologies.polymer.Linear(repeating_unit, orientation, n, ends='fg')¶

Bases: stk.molecular.topologies.base.Topology

A class representing linear polymers.

repeating_unit¶

A string showing the repeating unit of the Polymer. For example, "AB" or "ABB". The building block with index 0 in MacroMolecule.building_blocks is labelled as "A" while index 1 as "B" and so on.

Type:str
orientation¶

For each character in the repeating unit, a value between 0 and 1 (both inclusive) must be given in a list. It indicates the probability that each monomer will have its orientation along the chain flipped.

Type:tuple of float
n¶

The number of repeating units which are used to make the polymer.

Type:int
ends¶

The string represents how the end groups of the polymer are treated. If 'h' the functional groups at the end of the polymer are converted into hydrogem atoms. If 'fg' they are kept as the original functional group.

Type:str
__init__(repeating_unit, orientation, n, ends='fg')¶

Initializes a Linear instance.

Parameters:
  • repeating_unit (str) – A string showing the repeating unit of the Polymer. For example, "AB" or "ABB". The building block with index 0 in MacroMolecule.building_blocks is labelled as "A" while index 1 as "B" and so on.
  • orientation (tuple of float) – For each character in the repeating unit, a value between 0 (inclusive) and 1 (inclusive) must be given. The values give the probability that each monomer is flipped by 180 degrees when being added to the chain. If 0 then the monomer is guaranteed to not flip. If 1 it is guaranteed to flip. This allows the user to create head-to-head or head-to-tail chains, as well as chain with a preference for head-to-head or head-to-tail if a number between 0 and 1 is chosen.
  • n (int) – The number of repeating units which are used to make the polymer.
  • ends (str, optional) – The string represents how the end groups of the polymer are treated. If 'h' the functional groups at the end of the polymer are converted into hydrogem atoms. If 'fg' they are kept as the original functional group.
_x_position(macro_mol, bb)¶

Calculates the x coordinate on which to place bb.

Does this by checking the most how for down the x axis macro_mol stretches and checking the distance between the minimum x position of bb and its centroid. It then tries to place bb about 3 A away from macro_mol.

Parameters:
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The macromolecule being assembled.
  • bb (StructUnit) – The building block to be added to macro_mol.
Returns:

The x coordinate on which to place bb.
Return type:

float
bonded_fgs(macro_mol)¶

Yields functional groups to react.

Parameters:macro_mol (Polymer) – The polymer being assembled.
Yields:tuple of int – Holds the ids of the functional groups set to react.
build(macro_mol, bb_conformers=None)¶

Assembles rdkit instances of macromolecules.

This method places an rdkit molecule of the assembled macromolecule into the mol attribute of MacroMolecule. It also creates the MacroMolecule.bb_counter and MacroMolecule.bonds_made attributes.

Parameters:
  • macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The MacroMolecule instance which needs to be built.
  • bb_conformers (list of int, optional) – The ids of the building block conformers to be used. Must be equal in length to building_blocks and orders must correspond. If None, then -1 is used for all building blocks.
Returns:

None
Return type:

NoneType
cleanup(macro_mol)¶

Deletes the atoms which are lost during assembly.

Parameters:macro_mol (Polymer) – The polymer being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
hygrogen_ends(macro_mol)¶

Removes all deleter atoms and adds hydrogens.

In polymers, you want to replace the functional groups at the ends with hydrogen atoms.

Parameters:macro_mol (Polymer) – The polymer being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
place_mols(macro_mol)¶

Places monomers side by side.

The monomers are placed along the x-axis, so that the vector running between the functional groups is placed along the axis.

Parameters:macro_mol (Polymer) – The polymer being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
prepare(macro_mol)¶

Performs ops between placing and reacting building blocks.

Parameters:macro_mol (MacroMolecule) – The molecule being assembled.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
